We slept late everyday so left a "Do Not Disturb" sign on our door. But if we called before 2:00 pm, they would come clean our room. We always had plenty of towels and each time and always left us shampoo and soap. They left our room very clean. John, the General Manager, took time out of his day and talked with us about surrounding Daytona as we had questions about fishing charters, etc. We didn't partake of the continental breakfast since it was just donuts and two selections of cereal (not on my diet) but breakfast was available for a very nominal free. The outside area of the Inn was very beautiful and someone was always working inside and out to make it beautiful. This was an excellent place to stay and was also glad it had covered parking without a charge. Would recommend to everyone and I can't imagine having a complaint, especially how eager the staff was to make it right!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was very clean and great price.”
Reviews.Author: r0ss81
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. The rooms were very clean. The kids loved the free movie rental. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: inkedtc
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Oceanside Inn on Daytona Beach for our anniversary weekend. Our experience there was excellent. We chose this hotel because it is on the beach and allowed guests 18+ to check in. The rates were very affordable compared to the other broken-down motels and filthy hotels in the area. The rooms are super clean. The bathrooms were immaculate. We were very surprised at how clean the bathrooms were since everything is white. All the linens and towels were clean with no signs of prior usage. All appliances and cooking utensils in the room are clean. I want to give a compliment to LORETTA from the housekeeping department for being so hospitable and friendly when we asked for towels. They do have a $25 pool towel deposit per towel when you check in. The $25 are refunded back to you when you check-out and bring the towels back. I don't suggest taking pool towels at check-in since there are plenty of towels in the room, or you could always bring you own towel. The service is great. We came across the General Manager, Scott Hendrix, a few times while we was there. He is very active at the hotel which is ALWAYS a good thing. Both, check-in and check-out, were quick and stress free. There is a DVD rental machine in the lobby were guests are allowed UNLIMITED DVD rentals complimentary of the hotel. Lobby area is very clean and quiet. Agents at the front desk are professional and friendly. Seemed a bit understaffed but they managed to take care of all guests in a timely manner. WIFI is also available in all guest rooms free of charge so that was a plus. Another great addition is the parking garage. Keeps cars safe from rain and blowing sand from the ocean. As for guest safety, all outside doors are locked after 10pm and need a room key to enter the building. The food at the tiki bar was very good and affordable. We did not have the complimentary breakfast. It is a continental breakfast offered from 7am - 1030am. Best part about the hotel is that it is right on the beach. We had an oceanfront view room and it was amazing. Pool is overlooking the beach as well. Pool is open till about midnight and it is heated. It is walking distance from the boardwalk and oceanwalk village. A few restaurants nearby and a grocery store nearby as well. In conclusion, I would definetly stay at the Oceanside Inn again whenever I head up to Daytona. Thanks again to Loretta and all the other employees that made our anniversary stay at the Oceanside a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: jamesedunn
Reviews.Content: Nice motel, good value for your money. Wish it had an indoor pool, and the outside pool open until 10:00.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel on the beach with value added.”
Reviews.Author: QRPster
Reviews.Content: For this review, the booked rate of $69.00 + taxes & fees = 84.13 / night. At the above rate, my pre-arrival expectation was much lower than what was actually experienced. The hotel lobby & common areas were clean, the staff very helpful and very friendly. The rooms were adequate...(double room adequate for 2 adults, or 2 A +2 small kids) and clean. The air conditioner, although keeping the room nice and cool, was a little more noisy than normal. The bathroom was clean & with plenty of towels, however, the tub obviously had a fiberglass insert which gave under foot and took a little getting used to. The shower curtain was a little worn & tattered. The free continental breakfast was a plus, and for those needing a little more, a small in-house restaurant offering cooked to order breakfast at very reasonable prices. A hotel on Daytona Shores beach, of this caliber, for under $100.00, I certainly don’t hesitate giving it a thumbs-up recommendation. Say “hi” to Tracy at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Content: From my first call for reservations the service was excellent and due to a family emergency we had to change our date or arrival at the last minute and we were able to give them just one day notice before our arrival that was supposed to be a week later. The managers, the staff and everyone we came in contact with were so accomodating and helpful. The grounds were kept immaculate and the beach was just beautiful. There are lots of wonderful places to dine or just have a relaxed dinner. Lots to do and see within a short distance of Oceanside. We will definitely return at a later time. We live in Jacksonville, Florida (35 years) but never stayed on Daytona Beach. It was a really nice experience - TRY IT - YOU'LL LIKE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: SAJ9291113
Reviews.Content: I've never been to Daytona Beach before and didn't do any of the family "research" for this leg of our trip, so I didn't know what we were getting. First, the location from Atlantic Ave is in the rundown area of town, you have to drive(too far to walk with small children) to the pier or to the main shopping areas. BUT the location on the beach was great; right on the beach without having to deal with the larger resorts number of guests. Second, the hotel appears to have a couple of decades under it's belt and looks to have gone thru a couple of different eras, with it trying to upgrade currently. When walking to hallways to the rooms it looks like a dive, but when we entered our room it was very nice, and clean. Nothing under the bed or smells like other have said on this website. The rooms have 'beach view' if you consider it from the side of the hotel, but the price is great for what you get. Finally, we booked two double beds for our party of 2 adults and 2 children, but when we got there the hotel said that they couldn't fulfill that request because there was a JROTC drill team competition in town and all their doubles were sold out, so they gave us a king with two roll-aways. I would recommend this hotel for someone who is going to Daytona Beach to be on the beach, but if you are going to go for the shopping or posh resorts, move on down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Think About It!”
Reviews.Author: Rinsey
Reviews.Content: The check-in was fine and the staff was nice, but iwas totally disappointed with the room. There was a smell in the room, If you wanted pool towels there was a $25.00 deposit on top of the $50.00 holding fee (we went a bought towels for less than that). Then there was this sign posted, in a nice way, asking that you use the towels in your room more than once(we had to ask for more towels), the beds were uncomfortable.The pool didn't look so clean, but the acces to the beach was great.The elevators sounded as if we were going to be stuck in them at any minute. I would not visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “GM involved in day to day operations”
Reviews.Author: steve4608
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Thursday and checked in around 7PM, the night clerk put us in a room that technically was an ocean view as if you strained you got a glimpse of the beach. Night clerk said the hotel was booked and that was the only room unless I upgraded for a fee of course. Wanting to give my daughter a well needed R&R - so - I upgraded instead of arguing. Over the next couple of days I got to know the GM (Mr. Dion) as he is engaged with the day to day operations as well as interacting with the guests. On one occasion I related my check in experience which he listened and acted on. He called up to the room and said the upgrade was on him and "it is the right thing to do" He wanted to assure that my daughter had a good R&R. The facility is well maintained and does not show its true age. The room was comfortable and clean with good daily house keeping. The pool area is nice to lounge around and read by. Access to the beach is good and Daytona keeps the beach nice and clean. This is a good family hotel for both young and old.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed The Stay”
Reviews.Author: boldingc1
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very nice. The room was decent and we got what we paid for. For the price I don't think you could ask for any better. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is not high maintenance and looking for a luxurious resort.

Reviews.Title: “It have been better!”
Reviews.Author: rtcarter55
Reviews.Content: Our stay could have been better if the manager Scott ran the place with much concerns of the visitors stay. I called 3 times the week of when I was going to arrive and ask question are there any additional fees that I would need to pay and I spoke with Scott and both times he told me no. Well that was a lie when I arrive on 4/9/10 and had to pay $50 hold and $5.95 per day. Had I known that in advance i would have use cash, but it really inconvient me and my husband of the extra funds. We had trouble with the TV and watching movies, I reported that and they claim they fix it but it was not. I reported in 2 more times and that did no good at all. Than I wanted clean sheets and towels the next day, the towels I recieved but not the sheets. Scott said they dont change the sheets, so I guess they did not change them before we came and probably after we left. When I made the reservataion and also spoke with Scott i requested a king bed, microwave, ice box, dvd player and did it have a bacony. When we arrive I recieved it all except the bacony, so I was very disappointed that put a damper on my weekend. The room was face the ocean, but it was not the same. another issue was the smell when we arrive it was horrible, I started gagging when I got in the room, so we had to leave to go and get some cleaning products and air freshner. also when we was leaving Jennifer and Glenda was very help in checking us out I asked for a receipt for the $50 showing that it will be deposit back, scott comes out and said she does not need that. But the ladies gave it to me anyway. What gave him the right to make such a statement. So over all the serives with Scott was not good at all and at the hotel. So this would be a place I will not recommend to anyone or stay here again. Out of all the places I have stayed this was the worse one.

Reviews.Title: “This was a family getaway, the location...”
Reviews.Author: winterchic88
Reviews.Content: This was a family getaway, the location was great!! My family had a great time!! I will return

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: DougFranklin_Indiana
Reviews.Content: The front staff was awesome. Very clean! Right on beach. A lot nicer than the mom and pop operations on the beach for not much more $. IHOP has a good coupon that will save you a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “A fine experience.”
Reviews.Author: kytraveler_10
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel better even than advertised. Though on the beach, the sand problem was minimal. Everything was clean, and maid service was regular. The free DVD's were nice, and the hotel is located within easy driving distance of all major attractions. Plus, it is far enough away from the 'party hotels' so that a quiet stay is possible, if desired. And you can't beat waking up to a beautiful sunrise over the beach. You'll have a hard time beating this hotel for the price. The only (slight) disappointment was the surprisingly small fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Fluffy Pillows, thick towels, and a comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: Ocala_FLDiana
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my visit. Great room for the price. Would have liked a balcony, but everything else was perfect. I visit Daytona often and will definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Razer10
Reviews.Content: During our stay at Oceanside for 3 weeks in Feb 2010, we found the rooms clean, comfortable and affordable.The hotel and grounds were kept clean every day by friendly staff. The restaurant food was very good, we would like to thank Hotel manager, Mr. James Dion and staff for the great service and hospitality during our stay, " WE'LL BE BACK" ! Ray Harmer, Thousand Islands, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Joemama007
Reviews.Content: The whole hotel is outdated and the beds are horrible. Hotel fees where unexpected and unwarranted. The 'Complimentary Breakfast' consisted of cold cereal, a pastry and coffee and juice. Conveniently, across the hall is the restaurant with real food. Also, we had to leave a hefty deposit for a pool towel. In my opinion, this hotel is strictly for spring breakers.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful surprise! I will definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Wandergirl76
Reviews.Content: The Oceanside Inn was a delightful surprise. Daytona is not know for it's outstanding hotels, but Oceanside Inn was perfect. It was exceptionally clean, the staff was courteous, friendly and helpful, the room was impeccable, as well as comfortable. To top it off, there is free parking, daily continental breakfast and free DVD rentals for the length of your stay! All of this was for an amazingly low price. Don't miss this!

Reviews.Title: “A bargain!”
Reviews.Author: tiki44
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, clean and well fitted with a microwave, refrigerator and even dishes and silverware. It was nice to have the ocean right outside the hotel's back door and to have a sufficient continental breakfast at our disposal each morning. I don't think you could ask for anything more for the $69 we paid per night and I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Oceanside again or to suggest it to friends. I am sure there are more luxurious sites in the area, but not for the price. This is, by the way, largely a condo hotel where the rooms actually belong to someone and are rented out on a space available arrangement.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel, but decor dates back to 70's, needs modernization”
Reviews.Author: getmarshall
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel through a timeshare presentation. Was a bit disappointed, the hotel is a far stretch from what could be called the center of Daytona Beach. The area around the hotel is a bit depressed and there is not much within walking distance. The lobby area is decent, the pool area is just ok nothing spectacular. The rooms are very dated and old. The rooms were clean, beds were just ok, nothing spectacular. We did get upgraded to an oceanfront room, but the windows don't open so no way to let the ocean air in, which was disappointing. The continental breakfast is disappointing and should be skipped all together. The hotel staff though was very attentive and nice. Can't say that I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised.”
Reviews.Author: JayLewis
Reviews.Content: On occasion, my wife and I have taken advantage of the 2 night 3 day stays available for listening to a 90 minute spiel about buying timeshares. Normally the places they put us up in are dumps (in order to show how much better their condos are), but it's worth it in order to travel when we normally couldn't afford to, since we don't spend much time in the room anyway. As we were looking for the Oceanside Inn, we knew it couldn't be on the ocean side of the road, but it was. We knew it would be small and dirty (or large and rundown), but it wasn't. We knew that there would be no view of the ocean, but there was - from every room. What's this? A FULL kitchen in the room, including plates, glasses and silverware? Don't they know that we aren't going to buy a timeshare? How could they make the mistake of letting us stay in such a nice place. We won't ever go back to hear the same spiel again, but if ever in Daytona Beach, we know where to stay!

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST!!”
Reviews.Author: NeilSFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel should have been on the side of a highway and rent by the hour. The location was good, right on the beach, but that is where it stops. The lobby was run down, and the bed was old and had a large sway in it. The middle was 6 inches lower than the edge! That being said, these things could be dealt with, but the roar of the jet engine (air conditioner) was unbearable. I called to switch rooms, but the person at the front desk could not help. He stated that they were sold out. He sent up the maintenence guy who was nice, but could not fix the issue. I left a day early and went to a different hotel...without a refund.

Reviews.Title: “we liked this place”
Reviews.Author: marierika
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights. it is a very nice place to stay, for an extra $20 you get ocean view. The hotel is closed to the main street and the main shops around, if you want to visit the light house is within a 15 min drive. Continental breakfast is just enough, we did the buffet the first day and it was not too good, my husband liked it, but he was really hungry. they also offer free dvd rental, free coffee 24 hrs and wi-fi in the room for an extra $5. overall, Oceanside is a good place to stay, we though it was gonna be worst because we did the presentation w/ summet bay, the presentation was actually very entartaining, not a waste of time at all, because at 12 am, was very hot outside, and they also gave a gift card to eat in a very nice restaurant, called fresh...the food was excellent!! we a great time there and the gift card helped a lot, the bill was $100 total, but we pay $60, for 4 people. i recommend the hotel and the dinner at fresh.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: boysmomwellington
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. First of all- Ocean view for this hotel means that you are facing the street and if you turn your head just right at the right time of day and at the precise moment- you may see a sliver of beach. There were ants in the bathroom and bedroom, it was very old with smudges on the wall. The couch inside the room was "crunchy" when you sat on it. The glass table in front of the couch was greasy and looked like it had not been cleaned. The "complimentary" continental breakfast that begins at 7 am was gone by 8 when we got downstairs- the only other option was an $8.00 per person hot breakfast that really did not look appetizing. The outside Tiki bar did not serve frozen drinks and you could not charge anything to the room. This overnight stay cost us about 250 dollars and certainly NOT worth it! Don't get duped the pics online are probably pretty old. NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: megpit
Reviews.Content: We are currently on our fourth trip to the Oceanside Inn. We love it. We always stay in room 413 which is oceanfront and much larger than the normal rooms. It has a whole wall of windows with a great ocean view, a little living room, a king bed and a double bed and a small kitchenette. No, it doesn't have a balcony but who cares! It was two windows that open up and you can hear the ocean without any problem. The hotel is very quiet and a great place to relax. The pool is wonderful and has a small tiki bar and grassy areas surrounding it which are always kept up beautifully. There are chairs in the grass overlooking the ocean and picnic tables too. I've read several bad reviews and have no idea what these people are talking about. The halls are somewhat dark but have no smells, the continental breakfast is just that, continental, danish and juice and coffee/tea. Really, why the complaining, I've stayed in many more expensive places that offer no breakfast! I would really recommend this hotel it is quiet yet still fun.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: debmags
Reviews.Content: I too stayed at the Oceanside Inn through a Summer Bay Resort package. I stayed in room 520 and was pleasantly surprised. I was expecting to find a dump and found a decent place. Our room was clean and had a refrigerator, sink, microwave oven, coffee make and toaster. the grounds were kept up and I enjoyed the pool. A continental breakfast consists of Danish, coffee and juice so I didn't expect more than that, however they only put out about 10-12 small Danish at a time and when there are a lot of people waiting you end up only taking one. I had to sit through a presentation by Florida Sports and Recreation which is a joke, I can get the same prices that they claim they can. Dinner at Julians ( prime rib is excellent ) is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “mostly better upgrades except for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bobfitz1414
Reviews.Content: The changes to the hotel have been mostly for the better. The $5.99 mandatory charge for services not wanted or used can be accepted but the reduction of the free continental breakfast to coffee, juice and a couple of danish leaves a lot to be desired. The paid ($8.00) breakfast was very poor and places a libility on its reputation. In the past I go to this hotelevery four to six weeks and think I will go back, hopefully the management will reconsider the breakfast. Other than that the cleanliness, refurbished furniture maintenance and painting are a big plus

Reviews.Title: “Stinky stinky stinky”
Reviews.Author: abby1123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Oceanside over Memorial Day weekend. The first thing I noticed that I cannot forget is the smell. Mildew mixed with cat pee. It was pretty gross--so bad you didn't want to take your shoes off in the room. Other than that the room was ok. One thing that i thought was weird was upon checkin we were given a list of things in the room. We were asked to go through the room and list if there were any tears in the linens, holes in the walls, broken appliances, etc. We went over our room with a fine toothed comb so as to avoid being charged for anything we didn't break. This was fine and we got our full deposit back. One thing that was positive was our flight came in really early so we got to the hotel around 10:30, checkin was at 4. We thought we would go sit on the beach but it was rainy. They got us into our room right away, no problem, and with no additional charge. That's was awesome. The continental breakfast is a joke. Juice and danishes. The danishes were gross, coffee was pretty bad too. The beach is ok. BRING YOUR OWN BEACH TOWEL. The towels they provide for the pool/beach are tiny=pointless. This hotel is pretty far from everything. To get to Mai Tai bar was $11 with tip. The cabs in Daytona automatically start at $5.20, so you pay about an extra 5 bucks for any cab ride. We were able to walk to Ocean Dec from the hotel, took about 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here”
Reviews.Author: moreno0041
Reviews.Content: I was sent to Oceanside Inn by Summerbay Resorts after being at their resort in Orlando, FL. By the way the Orlando resort is beautiful! However, I was very disappointed when I was sent to the Oceanside Inn in Daytona Beach, FL. The hotel looked okay from the lobby but once I went to floor 9 where our room was I was slapped in the face with the smell of mildew as I got off the elevator. Once I entered the room the view was beautiful but everything else was horrible. the bed linens were damp, the chairs were dirty, and the room had the same old mold like smell. The pool which isn't heated as advertised was dirty looking. I looked around for 5 minutes then checked out. There was no way I was staying there with my kids. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. If Summerbay Resorts tries to send you to this hotel please refuse!

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Clinthimself
Reviews.Content: This place isn't too bad, but definitely not as advertised. No balconies at all and the swimming pool is not heated. Also at check in, there is a $250.00 deposit if your not at least 25. The general manager checked us in and then told us about the deposit. We had called the day before for reservations and nothing was ever said of a 250 deposit under 25. We asked the general manager why balconies were advertised online, and he said it did not. He eventually went in his office, checked the site, came back to the desk and apologized for the inconvenience. He did not mention the deposit again and said that the add would be fixed by that afternoon. I wouldn't want to stay here again. And i don't know about all the floors, but the fifth floor stinks like mold!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: HonestandSincere
Reviews.Content: Worst experience we have had with customer service. Front desk lady "and I have used that term very loosely" was the most rude and obnoxious person encountered in a while. They also scammed us out of $25.00 for a broken ironing board. We are guys so never touched the ironing board . When we asked for the manager, we were informed that it was in our contract and we should have checked it when we checked in and reported that it would not open from the wall. Front desk was terrible (same lady) when we arrived informed us that if beer was found in our room, we would be asked to leave. Paid in advance, no refund, or would have left. Not worth the price, nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for and it was ok”
Reviews.Author: kwoolr
Reviews.Content: I think for a family with kids this is excellent. It does not have balconies... Just a big plate glass windows ( you can open a window at the top) It has like 1980s color and styling in the room..lots of shell pictures and a little fridge and microwave. We paid 88 a night at the height of spring break...which is really decent fo the time of year we went. It has really good security and you have to have a key to get in after night. The free continental breakfast was ok but for 8 for adults and 5 for kids you can have a real nice hot buffett.The bathrooms are really big and all in all for the money..its really an ok place. The housekeeper was really nice and all the staff is very kind...Its an ok hotel and a heck of alot quieter and cleaner than alot of Daytona Hotels. Its got a nice kiddie pool and like a dated tiki bar.. but the beach was super clean. I didnt see anywhere close to rent things but about hotels down there were rentals

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: deeharleygal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oceanside Inn for part of Bike Week. There were five of us and after reading some of the reviews I wasn't sure this would be the place to stay, but I can say we were not disappointed. The room we had was on the first floor down the hall from the buffet area. We had a one bedroom efficency and it was perfect. 6 people would have no trouble staying in this room, I believe it was room 101. When you walk in the door, you walk into the bedroom with 2 double beds and a very large double closet and dresser with TV, then go into another door and there is a efficenty kitchen with refrigerator, apartment sized stove, microwave and all the essentials needed if you wanted to cook in the room. There is a dining table, couch, loveseat and chair with ottoman, along with a large desk, TV and another dresser. The furniture in this room must have been fairly new as we slept on the hideabed and found it quite comforable. Our traveling companions said that the beds in the bedroom were okay, a bit small since they were doubles and probably new mattresses are in order. But we were quite satisified with the size of the room and the cost was quite resonable even though it was bike week. Maid service was great, towels where large white a fluffy. We never did get a hot shower, but the water was warm and that was okay, since the weather was warm. We did not complain about the hot water, and probably should have, but we were having so much fun it didn't dawn on us to even complain. By the way our room had a large window and door that lead out to the pool area and a beautiful view of the ocean and beach. This room was also very quite even for bike week. Not sure what the noise would be like during the summer around the pool, since we never really saw anyone using the pool, everyone was out enjoying the rally and great weather. Even though we rented a car, we had a couple friends who rode their Harley's down. They had specific covered parking for the bikes and if we could get the car in the same lot we did that too. All in all great hotel and if you can get a room 101 you will not be disappointed. This hotel went out of their way for the bikers staying there,

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: pooh_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were very oldfashioned and the pool and bar looked nothing like they'd shown in pictures...!!!Piece of advice..never leave any of ur valuables unlocked even if the room is on do not disturb mode...'U DON"T WANNA LOOSE IT!!!' Because me loosing all my cash in the wallet (when it had kept in the hotel room!!!!) was just a cherry on the top my oceanside inn hotel experience!!!...I will suggest u guys to look out for other options and NOT to prefer staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “will look for a better place in the same $$ range”
Reviews.Author: jocker24
Reviews.Content: After reading your comments, we decided to book the Oceanside Inn ($69/night)and spend Labor Day weekend in Daytona Beach. Here are our comments: Pros: - large room and bathroom - kitchenette - free continental breakfast - no parking fee - free WiFi Internet Cons: - all rooms are w/o balcony - most of the rooms(at least 75%) are not oceanfront view - hotel and rooms were smelly - room was outdated - tiki bar (good try) - $1/day add charge for safe deposit box - a very long walk to the Pier :} We are not picky when it comes where to stay. Most of our time we are outside, looking what to do next. But, if we have a chance to chose in the same price range, why not?! After cruising around, we saw better places advertised for this price. Next time we go there, we should do a better search for a place where they have an oceanside room with balcony, closer to the Pier and more entertainments in/around the hotel. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service was great”
Reviews.Author: bigje7373
Reviews.Content: The customer service in all areas was excellent. The problem came when we went to bed. The bed was terrible and sagged in the middle. The maintenance men changed it out for another one but it did the same thing. It was a horrible night. ALSO--no balcony so there was no reason to have paid for an ocean front room. After one night we decided we had enough and the front desk was nice enough to refund me for the one night. What I found out about this place is that the rooms are individually owned so the management can't replace the furniture (beds) when there is a problem. The owners have to do that. Makes me not ever want to go to another hotel where individuals own the rooms. On a good note--the rooms were clean and large.

Reviews.Title: “Great week-ends @ Oceanside Inn”
Reviews.Author: mahalo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed @ the Oceanside Inn for the past five week-ends. Staff are excellent! Glenda and Felica @ front desk are great. Property is extremely clean and comfortable. Room attendants Kim,Shavon and Ara are all so accommodating. Thanks to Oceanside Inn staff and see you this week-end

Reviews.Title: “Nice Big Rooms with Nice Big Windows”
Reviews.Author: calebswife
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Oceanside Inn. The location was great, the room was bigger than expected, and free breakfast consisted of danishes, bagels, toast, oatmeal, grits, cereal-- not much, but it comes with the hotel stay. It was also a surprise to see a mini kitchenette in the room for the price we paid. We were here during Tropical Storm Fay and we experienced a blackout for a little while. It's was surprising that the hotel did not have a generator nor did they pass out flashlights. The hotel is right on the beach, but most of the hotels in Daytona Beach are. I agree that the bathroom sink did not have much counterspace, but there was lots of space everywhere else. All in all, a good stay. Breakfast could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Like2Stay
Reviews.Content: Nick was very helpful! One thing I can say... is for the money what a great place. Yea, there are issues.. our reservation was messed up.. but the curtesy of the staff in helping us resove our issues was immaculate. We made due... And the night guy.. I think his name was Stephen? What a great guy! Super nice and accommodating. Overall, I love this place.. not the Hilton, but I didn't expect that for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: rolffure
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Daytona Beach for the first time with our 2 sons-21 years old and 12 years old. We were there for 3 nights and four days and loved every moment of it. Staff was excellent, the rooms great-we were in an ocean view room. (Had fun watching people getting stuck on the beach!) My kids enjoyed the pool, I think its great that it you look out at the ocean as you sit by the pool. Overall we certainly would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but 5th floor smells nasty”
Reviews.Author: Yanay
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Oceanside Inn in Daytona Beach, Florida. It wasn't the worst thing on earth, but not the best either. To begin with, the hotel staff were nice, I only dealt with the front desk people. The only horrible thing about this hotel in the 5th floor atleast was the smell of it. I wasn't sure if it was the smell of people smoking or the carpet... ewww horrible! other than that the restroom was pretty clean when we came in, and the beds were a little itchy. The breakfast menu I did not attend so I don't know. Like I mentioned above it wasn't the best thing, but it was a sacrifice because they stuck us there with a hotel package.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for wedding guests and rehearsal party!!!”
Reviews.Author: momallstar2
Reviews.Content: Guests for my son's wedding (at least 22 rooms were reserved)stayed at Oceanside Inn and thoroughly enjoyed it - beautiful ocean views, large swimming pool, great customer service. We held a catered wedding rehearsal dinner there in the conference room and the hotel staff were attentive, professional and accomodating. Great for families! Plenty of parking. I would highly recommend the hotel for travelers - great vacation stay at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “A++++++++”
Reviews.Author: kygayle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were walk in customers. we were greeted by a friendly, competent desk clerk. we stayed 5 nights. Our room was very large and perfectly clean. Housekeeping personnel were friendly. Our only complaint was that there was no balcony, but our ocean front room had a huge window covering the whole ocean view end of the room. We would gladly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice gateway”
Reviews.Author: 1ucy
Reviews.Content: I stayed only for one night in a suite at the 9nt floor. Check in was fast, courteous and helpfull. View was beautiful and the room was nice and clean for a 3 star hotel. Breakfast was great and included. My only deception was the soundproofing. Our room neighbors was noisy (I assumed they're teenagers on spring break...) but somebody advised them at 23h15, so they stopped.... until 3h am! And woke me up. But the problem was fix again by the head porter. The pool was too cold for a heat pool, but the beach was very nice. Overall I enjoy my stay and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Left as soon as we could! 1-800-RUN”
Reviews.Author: DebVancouver
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Oceanside Inn for 3 nights but left in the morning. The staff offered for us to stay in another room but we opted to find something that did not have ants crawling on the food that was on the floor. It was not super cheap at close to 200 a night (Spring Break) and if there was zero's in the ratings that is what I would give. Our daughter lost part of her toy and when looking under the bed for it we found popcorn, cheerios, grapes, gummie bears and ants crawling on peanuts. Food also on the window ledges, and throughout the room. The staff did not argue when we cancelled the following two nights and left. The website makes it look A LOT better than it is. Must be original photos from many years ago or the webmaster deserves a gold medal for making their site look so good! Did not want to eat breakfast after seeing the bugs in our room. Could not see much out of the windows as it did not look like they had been washed in quite a while. Also I agree with the smell in the outdated lobby. Will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a budget”
Reviews.Author: stryder06
Reviews.Content: Ok. My girlfriend and I are under 21 years old so it is very difficult for us to get a hotel room due to other people my age going to a nice hotel and distroying and disturbing everyone there. So, we booked the Oceanside Inn because we could check in there. The hotel is pretty gloomy when you first pull up to it. The lobby is pretty nice but had some sort of smell. The staff there was nice. We had a problem at booking where they told us we did not pay the taxes on the hotel and the we owed $200. The problem was fixed immediately. The room itself was pretty large and the bed was comfortable. The TV had full cable, not the normal 7 channels you usually get in a hotel. The free breakfast was substantial and some bit edible. The main problem in this place is housekeeping and construction. Housekeeping is REQUIRED to clean your room every day at about 8 am. Now, this is fine if you eat breakfast, but some days we wanted to sleep in. You cant just tell them to leave, you have to open the door, and sign a paper saying that you didnt want your room cleaned. We had 3 housekeepers and only one was great, with a great attitude, so SHE got a great tip at the end of the week. The hotel is remodeling the 7th floor. Gets noisy early. But honestly, for a pretty cheap hotel on the beach, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this one!!”
Reviews.Author: dreamer43
Reviews.Content: Was impressed when we entered the lobby but the is where the wow impressions stopped! Elevators are small and outdated as are the bathrooms (not enough room to keep your toothbrushes on the sink!. If this hotel has had a recent updating they need to ask for the $$ it cost them back!! The best thing this hotel has is the beds & bedding!!! Large plasma TV but who comes to a resort/spa to watch TV?, I could stay home for less $$ if this is what I thought was impressive. The cable box on the TV didn't work and everything about the TV was inoperable until maintenance came and replaced the box. Shortly there after the new box stopped working so we fixed it our self rather that throw it off the balcony as my husband suggested! Upon checking out the front desk didn't even ask how our stay was (even lower class hotel know enough to ask this ) & when I proceeded to explain our problem hew reply was she would refer it to maintenance as though that would help us!! Even though the money is not the issue we have stayed in nicer and better appointed hotels for less. We had intended to stay another night but chose to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: keywestaxi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during an event in Daytona for $79 for a Jr suite, nice big room with small kitchen and comfy couch. No surprises, no bugs, clean, well appointed room. Bar downstairs has 2 for 1 all the time. Breakfast is all cold stuff but free, as is covered parking and internet, but signal drops quite often, so if you have an aircard, bring it. This won't be free a year from now. Rooms are very soundproof except for door closings in the hall (typical). Hotel is sold out and I haven't heard a peep. No sheer curtains, only heavy, so it's either light or dark. Balconies are absent but plenty of glass. Staff is friendly and helpful and American! Property is immaculate and I saw people outside picking up trash at 0630 in the morning, a good sign. Convenience store across the street for 7-11 type needs. I'd stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation, will be back”
Reviews.Author: cw70
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there last year and we are planning to come back hopefully soon. The price was good, veiw wonderful, the kids loved the pool as did I. The Tiki bar was nice, they have good chicken and fries. Breakfast was not to bad. They have a beautiful lobby with a huge fish tank the kids loved that also. The rooms were clean, housekeeping came everyday and kept the rooms nice. Over all it was a very nice Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ncemt1759
Reviews.Content: Great room, wonderful view. We stayed at this hotel on our honeymoon, and I could not have been happier. The floor to ceiling windows are great to watch the sun come up over the ocean. The attendant at breakfast was hilarious. Would definatley stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: jaal
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Wonderful hotel, great stay. Young lady at front desk was very accomodating and helpful. Nice size room, very clean, beautiful view of the beach. Although our room was located more toward the street, it really didn't matter the view thru the floor to ceiling windows was great. The pool was large and well maintained. Right on the deck overlooking the beach. The free breakfast buffet was very good. Plenty to eat. Free coffee all day in the lobby. If I ever go back to Daytona Beach I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: mrs_ping40
Reviews.Content: had a great time. Staff was very friendly. you can't beat the price. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: virginian60
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome place to take your family. A very nice location with a great price. Clean facilies with a very nice continental breakfast. The poolside tiki bar makes great burgers for lunch and the kids loved the pool. Nice sundeck and beach location. We will definitely be going back. We were in adjoining units 707 and 708 and the view of the morning sunrise was spectacular. Look forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: jetset1234
Reviews.Content: Only a one night stay for us, but next time we hope to stay longer. We will consider the Oceanside Inn, the next time we stay in the Daytona Beach area. Room 905? is on the top floor of this floor to cieling, mirrored windowed hotel. The room was nicely decorated, clean and free of unpleasent oders. The bathroom was a decent size, clean with upgraded light fixtures. A very nice comfortable room, clean heated pool, nice landscaping that you can walk or lounge on along with a clean soft sandy drivable coastline beach makes the Oceanside Inn, a very nice place to stay for about seventy dollors nightly. In the lobby area, we found the basic buffet style eating area, bar and excercise room, we were a little suprised with how clean the common areas were, especially during spring break week. Complimentary guest parking wasn't an issue, there is a two story parking garage available which seems suffient in ralation to the size of the hotel. The hotels location on A1A is good, there are resturants, shops, a large food store, a bar and fueling station that are either across the street or within an easy walk of the hotel. Night clubs, fast food, movies etc. are just north of the hotel. A quick cab ride will put you in the heart of all the action. Parking is limited in this area so there is often a charge for parking or valet parking. A cab ride may be your best bet, it wouldn't cost much more overall, and may just keep you out of trouble. A1A is WELL patroled by DAB's finest. Speaking of which, Daytona Beach's A1A area is looking better and better over the past few years, new pavement and designed brick intersections along with the new and or renovated hotels, minigolf, go-cart and waterpark are once again making this area attractive and fun for families and singles alike.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: candgk
Reviews.Content: The view from the rooms is fabulous, the rooms are quite adequate but our stay was terrible. First of all, they advertise that there is internbet available in the rooms. While I was there, the only place anyone could access the internet was in the lobby. When I complained at the front desk I was told that 1. It was the provider's fault 2. It was the fault of my computer (although no one else could access internet anywhere else, either) and 3.What do you want ME to do about it? Our second night there was a very loud group in the room next to us. They quit about 12:00, but then started up again at 4:30 a.m. When I pounded on the wall, they attempted to open the connecting door. I have never felt so unsafe in a hotel before. There are no instructions in the room on the phone or elsewhere as to how to get an outside line or how to contact the front desk. The lack of sleep and inconvenience we had just isn't worth the view!

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Had Hoped”
Reviews.Author: emeraldskye
Reviews.Content: When I booked our stay, this hotel was rated a 3 star, now it seems it has dipped to a 2-star rating...and with good reason. I wouldn't say this is an awful hotel, just an average room with average staff. It should have been cleaner. The pillows were very lumpy, and I had an asthma attack for the first time in about 7 years when staying here. (We only stayed one night). Not saying that the hotel definitely caused my asthma attack, but I was not sick in any other way and there was a sudden onset while sleeping that night. However, it seems one previous complaint others have written about has been rectified. Their breakfast was very good, offering several hot selections among the traditional cold breakfast items. Given the choice, however, I do believe I will look elsewhere for my next hotel in Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place....but”
Reviews.Author: UPMiGal
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Oceanside Inn for our stay. It was a fairly nice place to stay... but there were a few issues that will make me consider another place next time to Daytona Beach. During my morning beach walk, I did discover that (I do believe) the Oceanside Inn is the only hotel on the beach without balconies! We had an OceanFront room during our stay, but it was almost a waste of money. There's so much sea salt spray on the windows that take up the whole wall (very nice....but) that you can't get a clear view of the beautiful beach and ocean. the only CLEAR veiw you can get is by standing on a chair and opening the only window in the room, that is about 6-7 feet up above your airconditioning unit. and this "window" is only about 3' x 3'. All in all, i was just very bummed that we didn't have a balcony, when every other hotel on both sides had balconies all around. On the good side - the lobby was clean, the room was nice with a kitchenette (but don't expect the maid service to empty your coffee grounds or under sink garbage)- just no balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: vanner11
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone I know. I reserved the room online and it looked pretty decent from the pictures and decided to go with it. We only stayed one night but once I walked into the lobby I could tell this hotel was not worth the $100 I paid for it. For the condition of the place you would feel like you're staying at a cheap motel. The air conditioning was broken in the lobby and hallways which isn't great when it's 90 degrees outside. The whole hotel smelled stale and musty and looks run down. The people across from us actually had to switch rooms due to the smell. The room was outdated with mismatched lamps. We were facing the construction site which was only partly blocked because of the dirty windows. Our bed sheets had holes in them. There was also a small alcove in the room that was part of the wall with the window (which served no purpose) but had no shades so the sunlight was beaming on our faces when we woke up. It did have a refrigerator which was nice to have. The breakfast was just sad and consisted of a mini donut, muffin, cinnamon roll and an orange. The apple juice was just yellow water. I could not wait to get out of there and actually checked out early. I would recommend looking into some other hotels further north on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Send your mother-in-law”
Reviews.Author: QUARK68
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel 4pm 13th April 06,2adults 2 children(7&9).The hotel is dirty has a building site next door & sex shop 100y down road,great place for kids!!! The view of the building site from room lovely,the view of atlantic from poll area great,if you ignor beer swilling yobs parked on beach in fronmt of hotel playing load music and able to put 8 swear words in each sentance.They also had use of hotel toilts----both of them. The party in next room finish 1 am ----then started on their return at 4am,so when construction site started 7am---who needs sleep.On checking out at 9am,after discovering last occupants towels etc... under one of beds,a full refund was paid to us with no problem,they are use to it. The whole south area ,in our shot stay,resembles downtown Bagdad,bagdad may be safer.When rebult mat be nice but for now if your not theren to party all the time FIND SOMEWHERE else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just a 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yga07
Reviews.Content: This is just a 3 stars hotel..dont expect anything else. We got a good room, it was on the 8th floor (oceanfront) and it had a great view. I recommend oceanfront rooms because "oceanview" rooms are not really oceanview...in one side you have the parking lot and in the other side they are building a hotel. So, it's worh to pay a little bit more. The room was very clean, we didnt have problems with that. The front desk was just OK (was NOT the best!), but the venezuelan guy that works in the breakfast and pool (bar) area was very very nice. I would stay in this hotel again.. if i get an ocean front room on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Among My Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: ChrisIsOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: We had originally intended to stay 4 nights. We checked out after the first night. The place was awful. I have stayed in 5 stars and no stars. Not exactly a picky traveller. The staff was smoking just off of the front desk so the lobby smelled like smoke. The room was filthy with unknown "spills" on the floor, bedding and furniture. The bed was seriously uncomfortable. We booked an Oceanfront Kitchenette. It was a joke as was the continental breakfast. There was one bright spot. I needed to speak with the manager about adjusting our rate as we checked out after the first night of a four night package. After explaining our issues, she was apologetic and made the adjustments quickly and without a fuss. If you are totally desperate / absolutely broke this place is a maybe. Otherwise, shop further.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: mattyoglet
Reviews.Content: Overall This hotel is a great buy in a good location. My only problems with this hotel is their wifi internet access is restricted to the lobby and housekeeping was very late with cleaning our room (5pm) probably because of spring break. Id definetly stay here again. It is nothing fancy however it is clean and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean View? Is that what was behind the construction site??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible! Not even recommended for budget travelers. I realize we were down for spring break yes and I expected the worst but didn't realize what that really was until I checked into Oceanside Inn! I could tell from the minute we pulled up to the place that it was not what I expected. The "parking garage" has limited space, you can barely back out to leave, and you can't see around the curve to exit. Our keys worked sometimes. We had to swipe the key about 10 times before it actually opened the door, which would get stuck half way through opening it. Walking into the room it looked nice, somewhat outdated and horrible decorating but spacious. When I opened the blinds to see our ocean view room i was mad.. I know oceanview is not the same as oceanfront but i could barely see the ocean and right in front of our window was this construction site for a hotel that when it's built i'm sure will blow away the customers at oceanside inn. There was no blow dryer, lotion, shampoo in the bathroom that was cramped. your right leg is in the shower curtain while you sit on the toilet. The hotel smelled horribly all throughout and to add to that the second night we were there some girl ended up throwing up in the trash can on our floor. I guess someone thought it would be funny to put it in the elevator. We decided to tell someone about this disgusting act and when we did we came downstairs to the three security guards playing cards in the lobby. When we told them about this they acted like they didn't care and as soon as we walked away went back to playing cards. The smell was horrid and i almost threw up myself because of it. Not to mention the two pizzas that were thrown out someone's room all up and down the hallways. By the way never order from Alfredo's, the food is horrible and made me sick to my stomach. Finally when we asked for some extra towels because the maid never showed up that day to clean the room they told us that housekeeping had left for the night and we would have to wait until the morning. Horrible service! Not worth it! I felt bad for the families on vacation and I was mad that I paid as much as I did, especially with the horrible location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, No Problems!”
Reviews.Author: ocblondie22
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed at this hotel for spring break march 22-26. this is no 5 star hotel but i think people writing reviews previous to this exaggerated quite a bit. we stayed in room 503 and nothing was wrong with it. it was very clean. no mold, nothing. we had a nice view minus the construction next door. this hotel is older but it is kept in nice shape for the price. the beach is very clean with nice white soft sand, the pool area is beautiful, the water is crystal clear and there is plenty of lounge chairs. theres a tiki bar by the pool with drinks and a grill. the food is really good and price isnt bad either. we didnt notice anything bad about this hotel, seeing we were on spring break with tons of college kids in the hotel, of course its gona be messy and loud. we went in tons of rooms and they were all kept clean by house keeping and there was no mold or wear or tare. who really cares about the hotel, if you want excellent book at the hilton down the beach. i dont kno why ppl were writing bad reviews. but i guess ppl always find something to complain about. the only bad thing about this hotel is the "contiential breakfast" it is the cheapest. but i guess if they had a buffet people would take advantage of it. but hey they had food and it was free, im not complaining. the staff was very patient with us and very nice esp with us roudy spring breakers. this hotel is one of the nicest on the strip there are alot of hotels hit by hurricanes that are closed. id come back to this hotel the price is good the rooms are very large and clean and the staff is so nice. if you come to this hotel, eat at the ocean deck. its great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: avoid like the plague BLACK mold growing all over the rooms from the walls to the sofa. Eeveryone in my family could'nt breathe, and my 2 year old had to go to the hosp. Manager would only refund half of the monthly rate of $4200, and we were only there for 2 day's...

Reviews.Title: “It was ok..”
Reviews.Author: ebennett
Reviews.Content: I was very very worried about this place, the reviews I read on here did not really give it the best rating. It was nice. The restaurant was never opened though. Housekeeping was not the best at all. When we first got into our room I looked under the coffee table and there was an empty beer bottle there. They never picked it up the whole time we where there, then I was looking over the couch at the ocean from our room, and there was a huge finger nail clipping there! Someone threw it back there and housekeeping never picked it up! There were some stray hairs in the shower when we first got there, that was a little nasty. They totally missed us 1 day they never came to our room. The staff was very nice and friendly. The breakfast was good. The pool was nice. They were building a hotel next to it when we were there, that if we went back we would try that out. I dont think we would stay at the ocean side inn, just cause of the housekeeping. Our room did have a wonderful view of the ocean. Other than that it was nice, I am sure that it was just our room, the others were not like that. It was nice though. Worth the money for it. I though it was probably one of the nicest ones around there. If 1 day you are looking for something to do...go to the pier and rent a 4 wheeler! That was so much fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We Stay at the Oceanside Inn and had a room on the top floor with a great view, The hotel was very nice and off season we ask for a upgrade and it was no problem. Good price for the quality !

Reviews.Title: “OK, but a bit stingy”
Reviews.Author: GoodGuyBob
Reviews.Content: About me...I'm in my early 40's and was travelling for business and didn't have any spare time to enjoy the area. For the business traveller, this hotel is lacking. Things I am accustomed to but were absent are: a desk in my room, some form of internet service, a pad, a pen, coffee maker, and illumination (even with all the lights on in the room, it was STILL dim). Also missing from the bathroom are any "extras" such as a blow drier, lotions, and conditioner. (Note, you can get a blow drier from the front desk.) Although I didn't get to use any of these things, the pool looked great and the water was nice and warm. There was also a hot tub near the pool. Regarding the continental breakfast, it consisted of up to 4 kinds of mini donuts (powdered sugar, cinnamon, chocolate covered, plain), fresh apples, pancakes, frosted flakes, mini muffins, orange juice, and coffee. Regarding check-in/check-out, apparently you prepay your stay at the BEGINNING of the stay if you have a reservation. Another person was checking out who used a pre-pay hotel reservation (eg hotels maybe), and he was asked for an additional $3.39 which was in addition to the pre-paid amount for the in-room safe of $1.13 per night. I saw this charge on my check-out statement as well. Apparently whether you use the safe or not, this is tacked on to your stay. Regarding the "ocean view" room, your view can be better/worse depending on your room's location. The hotel is positioned with it's longest part running from the beach to the road. There are 3 "ocean front" rooms with a direct view of the ocean. These room numbers end in 13, 14, 15 with 13 being the largest. (I am going by the floor plan on the back of my door for the fire escape route – I didn't visit every room!) There are 24 rooms per floor, with rooms x01 and x02 being larger rooms facing the street. Then starting from the road is x03, x04 and so on…wrapping around the building and ending in x24 near the road again. Thus room 603 would be the farthest from the beach and would be more like "ocean glimpse", where room 612 would be closest to the beach, but not directly facing the beach. The pool is on the southeast corner of the building, so room 612 would have a good pool view and ocean view. The south view (rooms x03 through x12) face a hotel building currently under construction. The north view (rooms x16 through x24) face the parking lot. Only the west view (rooms x01 and x02) have no view at all of the ocean. Also, there are small clusters of smoking and non-smoking rooms as you walk around the floor. Be sure to state your preference at or before checkin. A business associate got stuck in a smoking room. In summary, I would say this hotel is best suited for the budget traveller who wants to be ON the beach and have a nice pool who's main concern is fun and frolick – perfect for the spring breaker, or a family vacation. For the business traveller, you'll probably be happier somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night from 11/12 to 12/12. We had reserved the room some 3 weeks ago from their own website. They reserved the room for us without charging the credit card at that time. We had specified a few preferances at the time of booking. We checked in late-night but they still had kept our room and fulfilled all our preferences namely, higher floor, oceanfront, non-smoking, king-size bed. Front-desk staff was very friendly and everything went smooth. We booked the Oceanfront Kitchenette for $79 per night. Oh was it more than what we expected!!! The room was big with wall to wall carpet, big and cosy bed and sofa, a 4-people dining table and chairs, a nice spacious kitchen area with everything that a good kitchen has sans the food, ofcourse. The biggest surprise was a leather reclining chair with footrest, right by the floor-to-ceiling glass wall facing the ocean, needless to say I enjoyed reclining in that chair looking at the ocean. Another surprise was the cable tv, I pay $50+ every month in NYC for that same cable, it had the same lineup of channels plus a few extra ones, not the usual 10-15 channels of the other hotels, half of which are local channels, I have stayed in. The view from the room is gorgeous, unobstructed view of endless wide ocean from everywhere in the room including the bed. The included breakfast was nice too, for the first time we had pancakes in an included continental breakfast of a 3-star hotel. Pool area is good and you can just walk to the beach from the lobby. In the morning we needed to print the boarding pass for our return flight to NYC, we had a wireless laptop and they have an excellent wireless network all over in the lobby, so we quickly checked in and then asked the front-desk lady to print out our boarding passes and she happily did that and we had our boarding passes in a minute. We had some doubts because of the word "Inn" in the hotel name and the low star-rating and that led us to spend just 1 night here and that was our biggest regret, we wanted to spend more time here and we will on our next trip to daytona beach and nearby areas, which I must say has one of the best beach in florida, we went to Miami, Key West, Clearwater, St. Petersburg, Tampa and Daytona Beach on this trip and the beach and water at Daytone impressed us the most. Highly recommended for a family or a group of 3-4 people, room is big and spacious, parking is ample and free.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Oceanside”
Reviews.Author: Tracytfox
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Oceanside in October 15-20. This was the week before Biketoberfest. We had a great rate from Orbitz for about $69 the first three days. We loved the area so much we stayed for 2 more. We would have stayed longer but prices went up sky high (200+) for Biketoberfest. The first night we were in a double room, but after we asked for a King we had it the next night and for the rest of the stay. Rooms were Very spacious, and clean. Housekeeping was very nice, as was the female at the front desk. The men at the front desk were a little short and rude, but we just waited for females to ask for anything. We did not do the breakfast thing, we bought some food and kept in room, so we didn't have to be up any certain time. Pool and beach were Very clean. We've been back a week and I want to go back! I recommend Crabby Joes, ate their 3 times, Inlet Harbour Restraunt ate there 2 times, and Bubba Gumps. Don't listen to bad reviews believe me, I live by tripadvisor. It hasn't let me down yet!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Time at the Oceanside Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Oceanside Inn right after Tropical Storm Tammy passed thru (Oct 7-11), and we couldnt even tell it was there. This beach front hotel was perfect! The pool and grounds was clean and maintained very well every morning, the room was comfortable and had a great view of the ocean. The upper sunning deck was flawless, perfect place to grab and book and relax. The free breakfast was a little skimpy, but had hot cakes and syrup and we didnt have to pay for toast like some of the reviews said. Housekeeping staff was always kind, front desk was a little short with us because we arrived so late after driving down from Ontario Canada. Would return again in heartbeat! However, they are building a hotel right next door which in the future could ruin the view of lower number rooms, so maybe try and request a room in the teens. Also, wouldnt hurt to bring along your own pool towels, there never seemed to be enough on the shelf. Overall, a wonderful stay and didnt want to leave. Daytona Beach is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend at the Oceanside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 2 young daughters and I stayed at the Oceanside Inn September 4-7 (Labor Day weekend). Upon arriving at the hotel late Sunday afternoon, I was told that they did not have a double room available - only kings. Since this wouldn't work she upgraded me to the penthouse suite for the same rate I was orginally suppose to pay for a double oceanfront. Very pleased - the room was absolutely amazing. Floor to ceiling windows in a corner room, full kitchen, 2 bathrooms, large living room and bedroom. The lobby was clean but a little outdated. Elevators were a little slow. Hallway carpets could use a good cleaning. Breakfast was average at best as mentioned in previous posts. The pool and grounds were very well maintained. Every morning we would watch them clean the pool, scrub the patio and hose off the sand from area (it was extremely windy that weekend - right before Ophelia). Plenty of chairs and a great oceanfront location. The tiki bar had a good selection for lunch. Nice 2 level parking garage adjacent to the hotel. Overall, we had a great time at Oceanside Inn. Would definetly stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Oceanside Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1909 S Atlantic Ave, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
